```{r}

# sum_var = "C24010_001"
acs_vars <- c(
  "cm_jobs" = "C24010_008",
  "cm_jobs" = "C24010_044"
)

chrt_dta <- tidycensus::get_acs(
    "tract",
    variables = acs_vars,
    state = "08", # Colorado
    geometry = TRUE,
    summary_var = "C24010_001"
  ) %>%
  group_by(GEOID, geometry, NAME, summary_est) %>%
  summarise(
    cm_jobs = sum(estimate, na.rm = TRUE)
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    pct_cm = cm_jobs / summary_est
  ) %>%
  sf::st_as_sf() %>%
  sf::st_transform(crs = sf::st_crs(3857))
  

```


```{r}

breaks <- chrt_dta %>%
  pull(pct_cm) %>%
  classIntervals(
    n = 5,
    style = "jenks"
  )

chrt_labels <- list(
    title = "Jenks",
    subtitle = "Share of employment in computer and math occupations",
    caption = "Source: 2021 ACS 5-year estimates"
)

fig_jenks <- get_choropleth(chrt_dta, breaks, chrt_labels, value_col = "pct_cm", outline_width = .01) +
  theme(
    legend.text = element_text(margin = margin(r = 10)),
    legend.key.size = unit(12, "pt"),
    legend.margin = margin(t = 5)
  ) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1))

save_plot(fig_jenks, here::here("export/choropleth_jenks_tr_cm_jobs.png"), chart_height = 8.4)

```

```{r}

# Create a histogram
fig_dist <- ggplot(chrt_dta, aes(x = pct_cm)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = .01, fill = "#00835D", color = "black") +
  scale_x_continuous(
    labels = percent_format(scale = 100),
    expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0))
  ) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0))
  ) +
  labs(
    title = "Computer and math employment distribution",
    subtitle = "For Colorado tracts",
    x = NULL,
    y = NULL,
    caption = "Source: 2021 ACS 5-year estimates"
  ) + 
  theme_cori_presentation() +
  theme(
    panel.grid.major.y = element_line(color = "#d0d2ce", linetype = "solid", linewidth = .25)
  )
  
save_plot(fig_dist, here::here("export/hist_cm_jobs_tr.png"))

```
